article:
I always knew I wanted to be a writer. Even before I learned to write, I would listen  _   to stories read to me. Then I would  _   them to my friends. But I usually   left out   things I didn't like and added things that I thought would   _   the story. I was not sure if my "improved new" stories made a lot of sense----- but my   _   seemed to enjoy them. In a way, I have been still doing the   _   things: listening to stories and telling them in a new way.
When I learned how to write, I   _   that I wanted to be a writer who would see stories he himself wrote in magazines, newspapers and books. The   _   "books" I wrote were for my family and friends. I liked my stories to have   _   , but I wasn't very good at drawing.   _   , my brother Daniel loved drawing, so he   _   for many of my first "books".
In the second grade, I thought I was   _   to become a published writer. With my mother's   _   , I started sending my stories to some big New York  _  . Although the editors never bought my stories, some of them   _   me to keep writing.
All the time I was hoping to be a published writer and my brother was   dreaming of   becoming a full-time book painter. So I was taking classes to improve my   _   . My brother was going to a   _   school to learn more about skills of painting. Usually, when I   _   a new story, Daniel would paint for it. We would get ourselves published as a picture book   _   and a painter.
